snippet: This grocery store has sooooo many alternative milk choices, the best in the city. I’m from Austin Texas!  Can use change to rent a shopping cart.

Came here to pick up some bits for breakfast. I got there super early  so the store was fully packed and well stocked. It s big store with loads of items. They revently reordered the shelves so things are in random places now.
Store missed out a star because I asked a staff member for chewing gum, they said its along there, and poi ted to where I was. I couldn't find it, that's why I asked. Then he said or look in the corner at the back if the store. Would have been nice to have shown me, or at least ask if I wanted to be shown

The parking is free for 2 hours if you spend £10 in the store.

Self check out, human check out and self scan all available

Not customer friendly i went into the store today the security girl a black girl she need to be taught customer services a friendly welcome smile won't crack her face  the girl that was helping on self check out she was so helpful polite and friendly excellent customer service
Never has any stock for anything, extremely disappointed. WHERE are te FROZEN sweet potato bags?? I doubt they are a HOT commodity? HMM

Came here to pick up some milk for my brother,
The store is large with a big selection of items.
The parking is for 2 hours if you spend 10£ in the shop, the staff in the car park is nice.
Self check out was moving fast and the woman there help us to watch my brother as he kept trying to run away. Altogether it a well run location.
Thanks
Ajla
Good shop, but the worst layout ever. Its so weird what they have done in this branch. You wont find anything!
Unhelpful, rude, moody and inattentive staff. They looked annoyed when I asked for help to locate where what I want was. Only if Waitrose next door was bigger I’d not come here.

A dystopian nightmare... step inside this Sainsbury's to view a time capsule of fluorescent purgatory. The year is perpetually 1984, evidenced by the beige décor, barriers to both enter and exit the store and big brother cameras at the self-service area watching your every move. If you want fresh fruit & veg, half the time you'll be faced with nothing but a few sad, wilted and mouldy items left lingering at the bottom of an empty box, whilst the rest of the shelves in the store are often poorly stocked. Beleaguered staff bark orders at the line of people stretching back through the store waiting to pay & leave whilst the exit alarm and self-service checkouts shriek a symphony of chaos, a constant reminder that escape from this purgatory is no easy feat.

Steer clear of this branch of the Ministry of Mundane Provisions.

This is a supermarket for those who enjoy a shopping experience akin to a Kafkaesque nightmare.
The entire store is absolutely freezing. If you don’t want to catch a cold in summer, bring a jacket.

Welcome to London's most depressing mega supermarket. Lighting so dim, you think you're losing vision. Staff with hygiene issues who have worked there for years. Merchandising and stocking seems like you're in some post-apocalyptic movie. And at Christmas, music blasting so loud you think you're at a rave. Floors yellow from when it opened in the '80's (?) Once I scan my receipt in the new barriers that trap you until you scan to get out, I run for my life.
I was there for work and it was quiet even though busy, staff were very helpful

This place needs better people at the Customer Service desk who are kind, helpful, and understanding.  Also the vegetables and fruits, and many products in the store are too high up on the shelves for everyone to reach. Sort it out.

One more point.  The baskets have sharp edges and have snagged my coat many times.  My coat is in tatters.  Sort this out please.
Nice and has changed and rearranged its ilses so easier to keep a constant flow when not too crowded. Better presented
Complete, easy and convenient. Make sure you get a nectar card

Came into the store with shopping mainly an Amazon brown bag full of fresh bread £40 worth left it somewhere in the store. Spike to the security with cameras told me to ask customer service - no return then told me to go to end of store …..???? By this time I gave up due to the fresh 5 x loaves maybe being contaminated….. poor service I shop in this store 5 days a week will consider to buy my produce now elsewhere
2 stars only because the shop I large. However no choice of NIVEA deodorants for men. Really? You know that NIVEA is making lots of different ones yes?
Brilliant staff pleasant and seem to go out of there way to make sure you have a great shopping experience.
6 counters and one being used, while people are waiting. Why have 6 if you're only going to use one ?
Employees were quick to assist when asked.
Quick and easy to use with helpful staff

6 counters and one being used, while people are waiting. Why have 6 if you're only going to use one ?
Employees were quick to assist when asked.
Quick and easy to use with helpful staff
This grocery store has sooooo many alternative milk choices, the best in the city. I’m from Austin Texas!  Can use change to rent a shopping cart.

Came here to pick up some bits for breakfast. I got there super early  so the store was fully packed and well stocked. It s big store with loads of items. They revently reordered the shelves so things are in random places now.
Store missed out a star because I asked a staff member for chewing gum, they said its along there, and poi ted to where I was. I couldn't find it, that's why I asked. Then he said or look in the corner at the back if the store. Would have been nice to have shown me, or at least ask if I wanted to be shown

The parking is free for 2 hours if you spend £10 in the store.

Self check out, human check out and self scan all available

Not customer friendly i went into the store today the security girl a black girl she need to be taught customer services a friendly welcome smile won't crack her face  the girl that was helping on self check out she was so helpful polite and friendly excellent customer service
Never has any stock for anything, extremely disappointed. WHERE are te FROZEN sweet potato bags?? I doubt they are a HOT commodity? HMM

Came here to pick up some milk for my brother,
The store is large with a big selection of items.
The parking is for 2 hours if you spend 10£ in the shop, the staff in the car park is nice.
Self check out was moving fast and the woman there help us to watch my brother as he kept trying to run away. Altogether it a well run location.
Thanks
Ajla
Good shop, but the worst layout ever. Its so weird what they have done in this branch. You wont find anything!
Unhelpful, rude, moody and inattentive staff. They looked annoyed when I asked for help to locate where what I want was. Only if Waitrose next door was bigger I’d not come here.

A dystopian nightmare... step inside this Sainsbury's to view a time capsule of fluorescent purgatory. The year is perpetually 1984, evidenced by the beige décor, barriers to both enter and exit the store and big brother cameras at the self-service area watching your every move. If you want fresh fruit & veg, half the time you'll be faced with nothing but a few sad, wilted and mouldy items left lingering at the bottom of an empty box, whilst the rest of the shelves in the store are often poorly stocked. Beleaguered staff bark orders at the line of people stretching back through the store waiting to pay & leave whilst the exit alarm and self-service checkouts shriek a symphony of chaos, a constant reminder that escape from this purgatory is no easy feat.

Steer clear of this branch of the Ministry of Mundane Provisions.

This is a supermarket for those who enjoy a shopping experience akin to a Kafkaesque nightmare.
The entire store is absolutely freezing. If you don’t want to catch a cold in summer, bring a jacket.

Welcome to London's most depressing mega supermarket. Lighting so dim, you think you're losing vision. Staff with hygiene issues who have worked there for years. Merchandising and stocking seems like you're in some post-apocalyptic movie. And at Christmas, music blasting so loud you think you're at a rave. Floors yellow from when it opened in the '80's (?) Once I scan my receipt in the new barriers that trap you until you scan to get out, I run for my life.
I was there for work and it was quiet even though busy, staff were very helpful

This place needs better people at the Customer Service desk who are kind, helpful, and understanding.  Also the vegetables and fruits, and many products in the store are too high up on the shelves for everyone to reach. Sort it out.

One more point.  The baskets have sharp edges and have snagged my coat many times.  My coat is in tatters.  Sort this out please.
Nice and has changed and rearranged its ilses so easier to keep a constant flow when not too crowded. Better presented
Complete, easy and convenient. Make sure you get a nectar card

Came into the store with shopping mainly an Amazon brown bag full of fresh bread £40 worth left it somewhere in the store. Spike to the security with cameras told me to ask customer service - no return then told me to go to end of store …..???? By this time I gave up due to the fresh 5 x loaves maybe being contaminated….. poor service I shop in this store 5 days a week will consider to buy my produce now elsewhere
